hint.text: All sides of a rhombus are equal

solution.text:
For Rhombus we have, ab=bc=cd=da=L=_{{10*j}}_
Area of the Rhombus(abcd) = area of the \(\bigtriangleup \) abc + \(\bigtriangleup \) adc
So for \(\bigtriangleup \) abc, we have ab=bc=_{{10*j}}_ and D=_{{16*j}}_ (given)
By using Heron's formula, area of abc = \(\sqrt {s(s-a_1)(s-b_1)(s-c_1)}\) where \(a_1\),\(b_1\),\(c_1\) are the sides of the triangle and \(s=\frac {a_1+b_1+c_1}2 \)
Here \(ab=a_1=_{{10*j}}_\),\(bc=b_1=_{{10*j}}_\) and \(ca=c_1=_{{16*j}}_\) so \(s=\frac {_{{10*j}}_+_{{10*j}}_+_{{16*j}}_}2=_{{18*j}}_\)
Therefore, area \(\bigtriangleup \) abc= \(\sqrt {_{{18*j}}_(_{{18*j}}_-_{{10*j}}_)(_{{18*j}}_-_{{10*j}}_)(_{{18*j}}_-_{{16*j}}_)} = \sqrt {_{{18*j*(18*j-10*j)*(18*j-10*j)*(18*j-16*j)}}_}=_{{72*j*j}}_\)
Similarly for \(\bigtriangleup \) adc we have ad=dc=_{{10*j}}_ and D=_{{8*j}}_ (given)
By using Heron's formula, area of abc = \(\sqrt {s(s-a_1)(s-b_1)(s-c_1)}\) where \(a_1\),\(b_1\),\(c_1\) are the sides of the triangle and \(s=\frac {a_1+b_1+c_1}2 \)
Here \(ad=a_1=_{{10*j}}_\),\(dc=b_1=_{{10*j}}_\) and \(ca=c_1=_{{8*j}}_\) so \(s=\frac {_{{10*j}}_+_{{10*j}}_+_{{8*j}}_}2=_{{14*j}}_\)
Therefore, area \(\bigtriangleup \) adc= \(\sqrt {_{{18*j}}_(_{{18*j}}_-_{{10*j}}_)(_{{18*j}}_-_{{10*j}}_)(_{{18*j}}_-_{{16*j}}_)} = \sqrt {_{{18*j*(18*j-10*j)*(18*j-10*j)*(18*j-16*j)}}_}=_{{j*j*72}}_\)
Hence area of the Rhombus abcd = area of the \(\bigtriangleup \) abc + \(\bigtriangleup \) adc= _{{j*j*72}}_ + _{{j*j*72}}_
\(\Rightarrow _{{j*j*144}}_\, m^2\)

content.text: In the Rhombus shown in the figure, L=_{{10*j}}_ m and D=_{{16*j}}_ m
